      • create

        public static Refund create(java.util.Map map)
                     throws ApiCommunicationException,
                            AuthenticationException,
                            InvalidRequestException,
                            NotAllowedException,
                            SystemException
        Creates an Refund object using the static properties PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY as the default public and private API keys respectively.
        Parameters:
        map - a map of parameters, valid keys and types:
        java.lang.Long amount
        Amount of the refund in the smallest unit of your currency. Example: 100 = $1.00 required
        java.lang.String payment
        ID of the payment for the refund
        java.lang.String reason
        Reason for the refund
        java.lang.String reference
        Custom reference field to be used with outside systems.
        java.lang.String replayId
        An identifier that can be sent to uniquely identify a refund request to facilitate retries due to I/O related issues. This identifier must be unique for your account (sandbox or live) across all of your refunds. If supplied, we will check for a refund on your account that matches this identifier. If found we will return an identical response to that of the original request. [max length: 50, min length: 1]
        payments.command.api.APIDescriptorCommand statementDescription
        A custom descriptor for the transaction to appear on the customer's bank statement.
        java.lang.String statementDescription.name
        Merchant name. required
        java.lang.String statementDescription.phoneNumber
        Merchant contact phone number.
        Returns:
        a Refund object.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException

        Creates an Refund object
        Parameters:
        publicKey - Public API key. If null, the value of static PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY will be used
        privateKey - Private API key. If null, the value of static PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY will be used

        java.lang.Long amount

This identifier must be unique for your account (sandbox or live) across all of your refunds. If supplied, we will check for a refund on your account that matches this identifier. If found we will return an identical response to that of the original request. [max length: 50, min length: 1]

                     throws ApiCommunicationException,

        Creates an Refund object
        Parameters:
        auth - Authentication object representing overrides for PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY and PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and/or passing an access token in for operations using OAuth.
        privateKey - Private API key. If null, the value of static PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY will be used
        map - a map of parameters, valid keys and types:
        java.lang.Long amount
        Amount of the refund in the smallest unit of your currency. Example: 100 = $1.00 required
        java.lang.String payment
        ID of the payment for the refund
        java.lang.String reason
        Reason for the refund
        java.lang.String reference
        Custom reference field to be used with outside systems.
        java.lang.String replayId
        An identifier that can be sent to uniquely identify a refund request to facilitate retries due to I/O related issues. This identifier must be unique for your account (sandbox or live) across all of your refunds. If supplied, we will check for a refund on your account that matches this identifier. If found we will return an identical response to that of the original request. [max length: 50, min length: 1]

        A custom descriptor for the transaction to appear on the customer's bank statement.

      • list

        public static ResourceList<Refund> list()
                                 throws ApiCommunicationException,
                                        AuthenticationException,
                                        InvalidRequestException,
                                        NotAllowedException,
                                        SystemException
        Retrieve Refund objects using the static properties PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY as the default public and private API keys respectively and the default criteria (max 20, offset 0, default sorting and no filtering).
        Returns:
        a ResourceList object which holds the list of Refund objects and the total number of Refund objects available.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException
        See Also:
        ResourceList

      • list

        public static ResourceList<Refund> list(java.util.Map criteria)
                                 throws ApiCommunicationException,
                                        AuthenticationException,
                                        InvalidRequestException,
                                        NotAllowedException,
                                        SystemException
        Retrieve Refund objects using the specified criteria and using the static properties PaymentsApi.PUBLIC_KEY and PaymentsApi.PRIVATE_KEY as the default public and private API keys respectively.
        Parameters:
        criteria - a map of parameters; valid keys and types are:
        java.util.Map filter
        filter.idFilter by the refund Id
        filter.textFilter by the refund description text
        filter.replayIdFilter by the compoundReplayId
        filter.authCodeFilter by the authorization code (Not authorization ID)
        filter.amountFilter by the refund amount (in the smallest unit of your currency)
        filter.dateCreatedMin*Filter by the minimum created date you are searching for - Date in UTC millis
        filter.dateCreatedMax*Filter by the maximum created date you are searching for - Date in UTC millis
        filter.depositFilter by the deposit id
        filter.qYou can use this to filter by the Id, the authCode or the amount of the refund

        *Use dateCreatedMin with dateCreatedMax in the same filter if you want to search between two created dates
        java.lang.Integer max
        Allows up to a max of 50 list items to return. [min value: 0, max value: 50, default: 20]
        java.lang.Integer offset
        Used in paging of the list. This is the start offset of the page. [min value: 0, default: 0]
        java.util.Map sorting
        Allows for ascending or descending sorting of the list. The value maps properties to the sort direction (either asc for ascending or desc for descending). Sortable properties are: id amount description dateCreated paymentDate .
        Returns:
        a ResourceList object which holds the list of Refund objects and the total number of Refund objects available.
        Throws:
        ApiCommunicationException
        AuthenticationException
        InvalidRequestException
        NotAllowedException
        SystemException
        See Also:
        ResourceList
